recipe_name: Lemon crème brûlée, marinated figs and pistachio
author: Lesley Waters
programme: Chefs: Put Your Menu Where Your Mouth Is
method: For the crème brûlée, preheat the oven to 150C/300F/Gas 2.  Mix together the cream, lemon juice and lemon zest in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer gently  for 10 minutes, whisking continuously. Remove from the heat and set aside. In a heatproof bowl, whisk together the eggs and sugar until light and frothy.  Add the boiled cream to the eggs and mix well. Pour the mixture into individual moulds placed in a roasting tin. Cover the base of the tin with water to make a bain marie. Place in the oven for about 30 minutes, or until they are set on the edges but still wobbly in the centre. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool.  For the figs, preheat the oven to 160C/325F/Gas 3. Place the figs on a baking tray and sprinkle them with sugar and rosewater. Bake the figs for six minutes. For the brittle, line a baking tray with greaseproof paper. Place the sugar into a saucepan over a low heat. Once the sugar has completely melted, add the nuts. Pour the mixture onto the prepared tray and leave to cool.  When set, break the brittle into shards.  For the crème brûlée, cover the tops with an even layer of caster sugar and caramelise using a chef's blowtorch. Serve the crème brûlée with the figs and brittle.
ingredients: 450ml/16fl oz double cream ,  50ml/2fl oz lemon juice,  1 lemon, zest only,  5 free-range egg yolks,  100g/3½oz caster sugar,  2 figs, quartered,  1 tsp caster sugar,  2 tbsp rosewater,  100g/3½oz caster sugar,  100g/3½oz pistachio nuts
